header.name: Accept
header.description: Content-Types that are acceptable for the response. See Content negotiation.

header.name: Accept-Charset
header.description: Character sets that are acceptable

header.name: Accept-Encoding
header.description: List of acceptable encodings. See HTTP compression.

header.name: Accept-Language
header.description: List of acceptable human languages for response. See Content negotiation.

header.name: Accept-Datetime
header.description: Acceptable version in time

header.name: Authorization
header.description: Authentication credentials for HTTP authentication

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Used to specify directives that must be obeyed by all caching mechanisms along the request-response chain

header.name: Connection
header.description: Control options for the current connection and list of hop-by-hop request fields[8]

header.name: Cookie
header.description: An HTTP cookie previously sent by the server with Set-Cookie (below)

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the request body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-MD5
header.description: A Base64-encoded binary MD5 sum of the content of the request body

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The MIME type of the body of the request (used with POST and PUT requests)

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats)

header.name: Expect
header.description: Indicates that particular server behaviors are required by the client

header.name: Forwarded
header.description: Disclose original information of a client connecting to a web server through an HTTP proxy [10]

header.name: From
header.description: The email address of the user making the request

header.name: Host
header.description: The domain name of the server (for virtual hosting), and the TCP port number on which the server is listening. The port number may be omitted if the port is the standard port for the service requested.

header.name: If-Match
header.description: Only perform the action if the client supplied entity matches the same entity on the server. This is mainly for methods like PUT to only update a resource if it has not been modified since the user last updated it.

header.name: If-Modified-Since
header.description: Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged

header.name: If-None-Match
header.description: Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged, see HTTP ETag

header.name: If-Range
header.description: If the entity is unchanged, send me the part(s) that I am missing; otherwise, send me the entire new entity

header.name: If-Unmodified-Since
header.description: Only send the response if the entity has not been modified since a specific time.

header.name: Max-Forwards
header.description: Limit the number of times the message can be forwarded through proxies or gateways.

header.name: Origin
header.description: Initiates a request for cross-origin resource sharing (asks server for an 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' response field) .

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific fields that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Proxy-Authorization
header.description: Authorization credentials for connecting to a proxy.

header.name: Range
header.description: Request only part of an entity. Bytes are numbered from 0. See Byte serving.

header.name: Referer [sic]
header.description: This is the address of the previous web page from which a link to the currently requested page was followed. (The word “referrer” has been misspelled in the RFC as well as in most implementations to the point that it has become standard usage and is considered correct terminology)

header.name: TE
header.description: The transfer encodings the user agent is willing to accept: the same values as for the response header field Transfer-Encoding can be used, plus the "trailers" value (related to the "chunked" transfer method) to notify the server it expects to receive additional fields in the trailer after the last, zero-sized, chunk.

header.name: User-Agent
header.description: The user agent string of the user agent
header.example: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:12.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/21.0

header.name: Upgrade
header.description: Ask the server to upgrade to another protocol.

header.name: Via
header.description: Informs the server of proxies through which the request was sent.

header.name: Warning
header.description: A general warning about possible problems with the entity body.
